result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Detainer Acknowledgement
Review hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:06 PM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay appeared by video from DCI.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for DeShawn D. Lay.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Matters are set for a Review hearing.  Atty. Galaviz advised that he and the defendant have not yet reviewed and discussed the report.  Court sets matter for another Review hearing date.
Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Institution
**Clerk emailed to Dodge Correctional.**

ADDRESS INFO for DeShawn D. Lay
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2022)
Prior: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188
Review hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

8:44 AM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for DeShawn D. Lay.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for hearing to schedule review of NGI report in October in case 22CF286. The other cases tagalong. 
The Dr. said they would do the evaluation by 9/28/22 and file by 10/14/22. Defendant would like to remain in the jail until then.
Court orders the Defendant to remain in Waukesha County Jail until after evaluation 9/28/22.
Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:30 AM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for DeShawn D. Lay. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Cases called for status. 
In case 22CF276:
Atty Galaviz  moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.  Evaluation to be filed by 9/30/22.
The other cases tagalong.
Cases set for a hearing toward the end of September to schedule the review hearing in front of another branch.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:16 PM Defendant DeShawn D. Lay in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for DeShawn D. Lay. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. 
Cases called to address Motion to Withdraw filed by Atty Galaviz on all active cases.
Court explains to the Defendant the circumstances where a Defendant can forfeit right to counsel on the record.
State to extend a global offer after the hearing. 
Court takes the motion to withdraw under advisement until the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

filed by Atty. Pablo Galaviz.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 07/25/22--The Court will address on 8/17; In the meantime, the Court expects Attorney Galaviz to continue to work on the file and for Mr. Lay to cooperate with the representation.**
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

09:14 AM Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court.   Defendant DeShawn D. Lay did not appear.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant refused to appear from custody.
Case called for Preliminary Hearing. Other cases tagalong. 
State requests that the court find the Defendant has forfeited his right to appear.
Court finds the Defendant waives his appearance for the hearing.

State calls Deputy Joshua Belfiori to the stand.
Deputy Belfiori is sworn in and testifies.
ADA Thompson questions the witness.
Atty Galaviz questions the witness.
Witness is excused.
The State rests.
The Defense rests. 
The State moves for bind over. 
Defense moves for dismissal.
Upon review of the testimony and for reasons as placed on the record, the Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the defendant probably committed the felony.  The court binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information filed. Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
State will confer with other ADA and victims to forward all of discovery and a global offer within 30 days.


  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
